sprint_goal: Foundational Excellence: Bootstrap project, DB, Docker, CI, observability, and complete user registration/verification flow.
key_deliverables: Runnable NestJS service in Docker; CI pipeline; End-to-end user registration with email verification.
demo_objectives: Show a user registering and receiving a verification email; Show the CI pipeline running successfully on a PR.
success_criteria: US-001, US-002, US-003 acceptance criteria met; CI pipeline is green; Service runs locally via Docker Compose.
risk_factors: RISK-004: Flaky CI pipeline; RISK-005: Silent email delivery failure.
mitigation_strategies: Parallelize CI jobs and use caching; Implement DLQs and monitoring for event-driven email sending.
external_dependencies: AWS SES configuration must be ready.
burndown_target: Linear burndown, aiming for 55 hours completed by end of week 1.

sprint_goal: Secure Login & Session Management: Implement the complete login flow (US-006) and secure logout (US-007).
key_deliverables: Secure login endpoint with JWT and HttpOnly cookie refresh tokens; Secure logout endpoint with Redis blocklist; CD pipeline to EKS.
demo_objectives: User logs in, accesses a protected route, logs out, and fails to access the protected route with the old token.
success_criteria: US-006 and US-007 acceptance criteria met; E2E tests for login/logout passing; CD pipeline deploys to staging.
risk_factors: RISK-001: Security flaw in auth logic; RISK-002: Redis outage; RISK-006: Redis performance degradation.
mitigation_strategies: Mandatory security code review; Deploy Multi-AZ Redis and add circuit breaker; Load test the auth middleware.
external_dependencies: AWS EKS cluster and Redis instance must be available.
integration_windows: Day 7-8: Integration of Redis blocklist with JWT strategy.
burndown_target: Linear burndown, aiming for 49 hours completed by end of week 1.

sprint_goal: Advanced Security & Recovery: Implement password reset flow (US-010, US-012) and the full MFA lifecycle (US-018, US-019).
key_deliverables: End-to-end password reset functionality with session invalidation; End-to-end MFA setup and login flow.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate a user resetting their forgotten password; Demonstrate a user enabling MFA and then logging in with it.
success_criteria: All acceptance criteria for US-010, US-012, US-018, US-019 met; E2E tests for both flows are passing in CI.
risk_factors: RISK-001: Security flaw in MFA or password reset token handling.
mitigation_strategies: Intensive peer review of all security-critical code; Use of well-vetted cryptography libraries.
integration_windows: Day 6-7: Integration of MFA into the core login flow.
burndown_target: Linear burndown, aiming for 51 hours completed by end of week 1.

sprint_goal: Account Lifecycle: Implement the complete account deletion and reactivation flows (US-015, US-016, US-014).
key_deliverables: Secure, GDPR-compliant permanent account deletion feature with a 14-day grace period; Account reactivation by logging in.
demo_objectives: User requests deletion; User logs back in to cancel deletion; A time-accelerated demo shows a user's data being purged after the grace period.
success_criteria: All acceptance criteria for US-015, US-016, US-014 met; E2E test for deletion lifecycle passes.
risk_factors: RISK-003: Incomplete data purge during distributed deletion process.
mitigation_strategies: Implement deletion via a SAGA pattern with idempotent consumers and DLQs; thorough testing.
external_dependencies: SQS/SNS event bus for distributed SAGA.
integration_windows: Day 8-9: Testing the scheduled purge job and audit logging.
burndown_target: Linear burndown, aiming for 26 hours completed by end of week 1.
